member.name: T:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper
member.summary: A bunch of misc editor helper methods

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.GetAnimatorVariableNames(UnityEngine.Animator)
member.summary: Returns the specified animator's variables names

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.GetInputAxes
member.summary: Gets all the input axis defined in the project's Input manager Credits: http://www.plyoung.com/blog/manipulating-input-manager-in-script.html

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.SetDirty(UnityEngine.Object)
member.summary: Marks the target as dirty for the editor to save it

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.IsSceneObject(UnityEngine.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified Object is a scene object

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.RepaintAllInspectors
member.summary: Repaints all inspectors. This is what essentially ends up getting called in EditorWindow.Repaint

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.GetFocusedWindow(System.String)
member.summary: Focuses on the specified window, and returns a reference to it

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.FocusOnWindow(System.String)
member.summary: Focuses on the specified window. Ex "Hierarchy", "Inspector" - pretty much any window under the "Window" tab

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.CreateScriptableObjectAsset``1(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a ScriptableObject asset at the specified path. ".asset" is postfixed if it doesn't exist

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.LoadAssetAt``1(System.String)
member.summary: Loads and returns the asset type specified by the passed generic argument at the specified type

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.LazyLoadScriptableAsset``1(``0@,System.String)
member.summary: Lazy-Loads and returns the asset type specified by the passed generic argument at the specified type That is, if 'value' was not null it gets returned, otherwise we assign it an asset of type T at 'path' if 'value' is still null, we create an asset of type T at path and return it

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.LazyLoadScriptableAsset``1(``0@,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Lazy-Loads and returns the asset type specified by the passed generic argument at the specified type That is, if 'value' was not null it gets returned, otherwise we assign it an asset of type T at 'path' if 'value' is still null, we create an asset of type T at path and return it. Pass in true to 'log' to get feedback if no asset of type T was found.

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.PingObject(UnityEngine.Object)
member.summary: Pings the specified object

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.SelectObjects(UnityEngine.Object[])
member.summary: Selects the specified objects

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.SelectObject(UnityEngine.Object)
member.summary: Selects the specified object

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.InspectTarget(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Creates a new inspector window instance and locks it to inspect the specified target

member.name: P:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.Tags
member.summary: Returns all the tags used in the project

member.name: P:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.Layers
member.summary: Returns all the layers used in the project

member.name: P:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.InspectorWindowType
member.summary: Gets a Type object for the type 'InspectorWindow'

member.name: P:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.CachedInspectorWindowType
member.summary: Returns a cached value for the Type object of the type 'InspectorWindow'

member.name: P:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.EditorHelper.ScriptableAssetsPath
member.summary: Returns the full path of the "ScriptableAssets" directory

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Extensions.GOExtensions.UndoGetOrAddComponent``1(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Gets the component of the specific generic type if not found, we add it and register an undo for it at the end it gets returned

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Extensions.SerializedPropertyExtensions.GetRefValue``1(UnityEditor.SerializedProperty)
member.summary: Gets the property value by performing a safe cast

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Extensions.SerializedPropertyExtensions.GetValue``1(UnityEditor.SerializedProperty)
member.summary: Gets the property value by performing an un-safe cast

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Extensions.UnityEngineObjectExtensions.SetDirty(UnityEngine.Object)
member.summary: Marks the target as dirty for the editor to save it

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.PrefabHelper.IsPrefabInstance(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified gameObject is a prefab instance (connected to a prefab)

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.PrefabHelper.IsPrefab(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Returns true if the speicified gameObject is a prefab

member.name: M:Vexe.Editor.Helpers.PrefabHelper.UpdatePrefab(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Connects the specified prefab instance to the prefab (equivalent of pressing apply from the prefab instance)
